title: 110_s2586
content: The Act may be cited as the "State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008" and provides temporary state fiscal relief. The "State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008" allows for a temporary increase in the Medicaid FMAP for certain quarters in fiscal years 2008 and 2009 based on specific conditions. The State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008 provides a temporary increase in Medicaid FMAP for specific quarters in fiscal years 2008 and 2009. This includes a general 1.225 percentage points increase for certain quarters and an increase in the cap on Medicaid payments to territories. The State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008 temporarily increases Medicaid FMAP for specific quarters in fiscal years 2008 and 2009. The increases apply to Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa, with a 2.45 percent increase. The FMAP increases only apply to title XIX of the Social Security Act and do not apply to disproportionate share hospital payments. State eligibility for increased FMAP or cap amounts under the State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008 is contingent on compliance with State plan requirements under title XIX of the Social Security Act. This includes any waivers or section 1115 agreements. State eligibility for increased FMAP or cap amounts under the State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008 is based on compliance with State plan requirements under title XIX of the Social Security Act, including any waivers or section 1115 agreements. A State can qualify for increased funding if it reinstates eligibility that is no more restrictive than the eligibility in effect on December 31, 2007. The State Medicaid program must maintain eligibility criteria as of December 31, 2007, to qualify for increased funding under the State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008. States requiring political subdivisions to contribute to Medicaid expenses cannot impose additional payments on these subdivisions. The State Medicaid program must maintain eligibility criteria as of December 31, 2007, to qualify for increased funding under the State Fiscal Relief Act of 2008. Political subdivisions contributing to Medicaid expenses cannot be required to pay a higher percentage for certain quarters in fiscal years 2008 and 2009 than what was required by the State on December 31, 2007. The terms "FMAP" and "State" are defined in this subsection. This provision is repealed as of October 1, 2009. Repeal of subsection effective October 1, 2009. Amendment to the Social Security Act for payments to states for government services. TITLE VI--TEMPORARY STATE FISCAL RELIEF. SEC. 601. TEMPORARY STATE FISCAL RELIEF. Authorization of funds for payments to States under this section: $3.6 billion for fiscal year 2008 and $2.4 billion for fiscal year 2009. The Secretary of the Treasury will make payments to States based on certifications provided, with specific timelines outlined for each fiscal year. The Treasury will pay each State an amount determined for fiscal year 2009 based on population proportions. No State shall receive less than a minimum payment specified. The Treasury will adjust payments to States for fiscal year 2009 based on population proportions, with minimum payment guarantees. The relative population proportion amount for a fiscal year is determined by multiplying the amount described in subsection (a) by the relative State population proportion, which is calculated based on the State's population in the most recent census compared to the total population of all States. The State shall use funds provided under this section for essential government services, complying with Federal mandates, or compensating for a decline in Federal funding. The State can only use funds for approved expenditures and must certify their proposed uses to receive payment. The term 'State' includes various territories, and the title is repealed as of October 1, 2009.
